required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 16, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of INC280 Alone, and in Combination With Erlotinib, Compared to Chemotherapy, in Advanced/Metastatic Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Patients With EGFR Mutation and cMET Amplification
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib/II, Open-label, Multicenter Trial With Oral cMET Inhibitor INC280 Alone and in Combination With Erlotinib Versus Platinum With Pemetrexed in Adult Patients With EGFR Mutated, cMET-amplified, Locally Advanced/Metastatic Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) With Acquired Resistance to Prior EGFR Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitor (EGFR TKI)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) or recommended phase II dose (RP2D) of INC280 in combination with erlotinib in the Phase Ib of this study, and to assess the anti-tumor activity and safety of INC280 alone, and in combination with erlotinib, versus platinum with pemetrexed in the Phase II of this study, in adult patients with EGFR mutated, cMET amplified, advanced/metastatic non-small cell lung cancer with acquired resistance to prior EGFR TKI.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Frequency and characteristics of Dose Limiting Toxicity (DLTs) to the INC280 and erlotinib combination

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients progression-free by investigator assessment per RECIST v1.1.

secondary_outcome.description: ORR, proportion of patients with a best overall response of complete response or partial response (CR+PR)
OS, defined as time from the first dose of study treatment to death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Number of patients with adverse events (AEs) as a measure of safety and tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of INC280 in combination with erlotinib assessed by change in vital signs, laboratory results and electrocardiogram (ECG).

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Plasma concentration-time profiles of INC280 and pharmacokinetic parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Composite pharmacokinetics of INC280 in the presence of erlotinib.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Plasma concentration-time profiles of erlotinib in the presence of INC280
secondary_outcome.description: Composite pharmacokinetics of erlotinib in the presence of INC280.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Overall Response Rate (ORR) by investigator's assessment according to RECIST v1.1
secondary_outcome.description: ORR, proportion of patients with a best overall response of complete response or partial response (CR+PR)
OS, defined as time from randomization to death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Number of patients with AEs/serious adverse events (SAEs) as a measure of safety and tolerability (INC280 + erlotinib)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of the combination of INC280 and erlotinib assesed by change in vital signs, laboratory results and ECG.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Number of patients with AEs/SAEs as a measure of safety and tolerability (INC280 alone)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of INC280 single agent assesed by change in vital signs, laboratory results and ECG.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Plasma concentration of INC280 (INC280 + erlotinib)
secondary_outcome.description: Composite Pharmacokinetics (PK) of INC280 in the presence of erlotinib

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Phase II: Plasma concentration of INC280 (INC280 alone)
secondary_outcome.description: Composite PK of INC280 single agent

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Plama concentrations of INC280 (erlotinib + INC280)
secondary_outcome.description: Composite PK of erlotinib in the presence of INC280.
DCR, proportion of patients with best overall response of CR, PR or SD
DOR, defined as time from the first documented CR or PR to first documented progression or death due to any cause
PFS, defined as time from the first dose of study treatment to disease progression or death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Disease Control Rate (DCR) by investigator's assessment according to RECIST v1.1
secondary_outcome.description: DCR, proportion of patients with best overall response of CR, PR or SD

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Duration of Response (DOR) by investigator's assessment according to RECIST v1.1
secondary_outcome.description: DOR, defined as time from the first documented CR or PR to first documented progression or death due to any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase Ib: Number of patients with serious adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability of INC280 in combination with erlotinib assessed by change in vital signs, laboratory results and electrocardiogram (ECG).

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase II: Overall Response Rate (ORR), Disease Control Rate by investigator's assessment according to RECIST v1.1
secondary_outcome.description: ORR, proportion of patients with a best overall response of complete response or partial response (CR+PR)

arm_group.description: Platinum (cisplatin or carboplatin) in combination with pemetrexed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC
- EGFR mutation (L858R and /or ex19del)
- cMET amplification by FISH (GCN ≥ 6),
- Acquired resistance to EGFR TKI (1st or 2nd génération)
- ECOG performance status (PS) ≤ 1.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment with 3rd generation TKI
- PhaseII : Prior treatment with any of the following agents:
- Crizotinib, or any other cMET inhibitor or HGF-targeting inhibitor.
- Concomitant EGFR TKI and platinum based chemotherapy as first line regimen.
- Platinum-based chemotherapy as first line treatment
